title: GRIS
why: A stunning visual experience. Its art style is painterly and poetic, paired with an award-winning, emotional soundtrack. There's no combat — just climbing virtual platforms, beautiful landscapes, puzzles, and a symbolic story of healing.
bestFor: Players who want a short, introspective experience that feels more like art than traditional gameplay.

title: Outer Wilds
why: A serene but mind-blowing space exploration game—you’re uncovering cosmic mysteries orbit by orbit. It’s all about curiosity, gentle realization, and that “aha!” moment when the universe reveals its secrets.
bestFor: Players who love exploration and discovery, with no pressure—just the joy of drifting through solar systems, piecing together a cosmic puzzle.

title: Stardew Valley
why: A cozy farming life with seasonal charm, deep friendships, and endless discovery. Each season brings new visuals and there's just enough of a plot to not get bored.
bestFor: Anyone who loves immersive, gentle gameplay that evolves over time—and maybe wants to build a virtual farmstead and family at their own pace.

title: Call of the Sea
why: A gorgeous, puzzle-rich journey on a mysterious island. The story pulled me in right away—and I couldn’t stop until I unraveled every secret and embraced that sense of wonder.
bestFor: Fans of atmospheric exploration and thoughtful puzzles—with a captivating story that leaves you thinking long afterward.

title: What Remains of Edith Finch
why: A breathtaking narrative walk-through. Each vignette is a fresh emotional ride, weaving a beautiful, bittersweet tapestry about family and memory. It felt like reading a moving collection of shocking and bittersweet stories.
bestFor: Players who adore storytelling and can spend just 1–2 hours in an immersive, unforgettable world.

title: Dorfromantik
why: A chill, tile-based building puzzle that feels like crafting a peaceful miniature world. Soothing music, gentle strategy—it’s perfect to unwind and needs no deep thought.
bestFor: Anyone who truly just wants to relax, meditative game experience without pressure—just pure zen tile placement.

title: Assemble with Care
why: A sweet little narrative about repairing broken things—and hearts. It’s gentle, heartfelt, and feels like you're helping someone put their world back together.
bestFor: Players who like short, emotional stories with light puzzles and a soul-warming vibe.

title: Little Witch in the Woods
why: A magical, cozy adventure where you brew potions, befriend woodland creatures, and explore enchanted forests. It’s whimsical, comforting, and simply delightful.
bestFor: Anyone who wants a cozy life sim sprinkled with magic and sunny exploration.

title: Spiritfarer
why: A beautifully animated management game about helping spirits pass on. It’s emotional and therapeutic, wrapped in comforting art and music.
bestFor: Players who love meaningful gameplay and aren’t afraid to shed a tear or two along the way.

title: Eastshade
why: You play a traveling painter exploring a lush world. There’s no combat, just inspiration, discovery, and gentle quests.
bestFor: Creative souls who want exploration and atmosphere over action.

title: A Short Hike
why: A tiny game with a big heart. Explore, talk to strangers, find feathers, and relax in a vibrant wilderness with no stress at all.
bestFor: Quick cozy sessions that leave a smile on your face.

title: Unpacking
why: A meditative game about unpacking a life, one box at a time. No time limits or scores—just vibes.
bestFor: Those who love gentle puzzles and storytelling through visuals.

title: Slime Rancher
why: Catch cute bouncing slimes, build a cozy ranch, and discover strange lands. It’s weird, fun, and totally chill.
bestFor: Wholesome fun with lots of color and collecting satisfaction.

title: Lake
why: Deliver mail and reconnect with people in your hometown. A relaxing slice-of-life experience.
bestFor: Those craving simplicity, nostalgia, and small-town vibes.

title: Cozy Grove
why: Like Animal Crossing meets ghost stories. Help spirits, collect resources, and watch the island grow and change daily.
bestFor: Players who want long-term cozy play with gentle narrative and progression.
